   20: 
   21: 
   22: -module(port_trace_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   25:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   27: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   28: -export([port_specs/1, ports/1, open_close/1,
   29:          command/1, control/1, connect/1, call/1,
   30:          output/1, output2/1, output_binary/1,
   31:          outputv/1, set_timer/1, failure_eof/1,
   32:          failure_atom/1, failure_posix/1,
   33:          failure/1, output_term/1,
   34:          driver_output_term/1,
   35:          send_term/1, driver_send_term/1,
   36:          driver_remote_send_term/1]).
   37: 
   38: -define(ECHO_DRV_NOOP, 0).
   39: -define(ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT, 1).
   40: -define(ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT2, 2).
   41: -define(ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT_BINARY, 3).
   42: -define(ECHO_DRV_OUTPUTV, 4).
   43: -define(ECHO_DRV_SET_TIMER, 5).
   44: -define(ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_EOF, 6).
   45: -define(ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_ATOM, 7).
   46: -define(ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_POSIX, 8).
   47: -define(ECHO_DRV_FAILURE, 9).
   48: -define(ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT_TERM, 10).
   49: -define(ECHO_DRV_DRIVER_OUTPUT_TERM, 11).
   50: -define(ECHO_DRV_SEND_TERM, 12).
   51: -define(ECHO_DRV_DRIVER_SEND_TERM, 13).
   52: -define(ECHO_DRV_SAVE_CALLER, 14).
   53: -define(ECHO_DRV_REMOTE_SEND_TERM, 15).
   54: 
   55: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   56:             {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   57: 
   58: all() ->
   59:     trace_sessions:all().
   60: 
   61: groups() ->
   62:     trace_sessions:groups(testcases()).
   63: 
   64: testcases() ->
   65:     [port_specs, ports, open_close,
   66:      command, control, connect, call,
   67:      output, output2, output_binary,
   68:      outputv, set_timer, failure_eof,
   69:      failure_atom, failure_posix,
   70:      failure, output_term,
   71:      driver_output_term,
   72:      send_term, driver_send_term,
   73:      driver_remote_send_term].
   74: 
   75: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   76:     trace_sessions:init_per_suite(Config).
   77: 
   78: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   79:     trace_sessions:end_per_suite(Config).
   80: 
   81: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
   82:     trace_sessions:init_per_group(Group, Config).
   83: 
   84: end_per_group(Group, Config) ->
   85:     trace_sessions:end_per_group(Group, Config).
   86: 
   87: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   88:     erlang_trace(all, false, [all]),
   89:     os:unsetenv("OUTPUTV"),
   90:     reload_drv(Config),
   91: 
   92:     trace_sessions:init_per_testcase(Config).
   93: 
   94: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   95:     erlang_trace(all, false, [all]),
   96:     trace_sessions:end_per_testcase(Config).
   97: 
   98: 
   99: erlang_trace(A,B,C) ->
  100:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace(A,B,C).
  101: 
  102: %erlang_trace_pattern(A,B,C) ->
  103: %    trace_sessions:erlang_trace_pattern(A,B,C).
  104: 
  105: erlang_trace_info(A,B) ->
  106:     trace_sessions:erlang_trace_info(A,B).
  107: 
  108: 
  109: %% Test the first argument of trace/3
  110: port_specs(_Config) ->
  111: 
  112:     S = self(),
  113: 
  114:     Tracer = fun F() ->
  115:                      receive
  116:                          stop ->
  117:                              ok;
  118:                          M ->
  119:                              S ! M,
  120:                              F()
  121:                      end
  122:              end,
  123: 
  124:     Test = fun(TraceSpec, Info1, Info2) ->
  125:                    {TracerPid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(Tracer),
  126:                    Prt1 = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [binary]),
  127:                    erlang_trace(TraceSpec, true, ['receive', {tracer, TracerPid}]),
  128:                    %% We disable trace messages from the testcase process
  129:                    erlang_trace(self(), false, ['receive']),
  130:                    Prt2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [binary]),
  131: 
  132:                    InfoCheck =
  133:                        fun(Info, Prt) ->
  134:                                if
  135:                                    Info ->
  136:                                        {tracer, TracerPid} = erlang_trace_info(Prt, tracer),
  137:                                        {flags,['receive']} = erlang_trace_info(Prt, flags);
  138:                                    not Info ->
  139:                                        {tracer,[]} = erlang_trace_info(Prt, tracer),
  140:                                        {flags,[]} = erlang_trace_info(Prt, flags)
  141:                                end
  142:                        end,
  143:                    InfoCheck(Info1, Prt1),
  144:                    InfoCheck(Info2, Prt2),
  145: 
  146:                    %% These may create trace messages
  147:                    erlang:port_command(Prt1, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>),
  148:                    erlang:port_command(Prt2, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>),
  149: 
  150:                    %% Test what happens when the tracer dies
  151:                    trace_delivered(),
  152:                    TracerPid ! stop,
  153:                    receive {'DOWN', Ref, process, TracerPid, normal} -> ok end,
  154: 
  155:                    %% These should not generate any trace messages
  156:                    erlang:port_command(Prt1, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>),
  157:                    erlang:port_command(Prt2, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>),
  158: 
  159:                    InfoCheck(false, Prt1),
  160:                    InfoCheck(false, Prt2),
  161: 
  162:                    erlang:port_close(Prt1),
  163:                    erlang:port_close(Prt2),
  164:                    erlang_trace(all, false, [all]),
  165:                    {Prt1, Prt2}
  166:            end,
  167: 
  168:     {_Prt11, Prt12} = Test(new, false, true),
  169:     [{trace, Prt12, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  170:         = flush(Prt12),
  171: 
  172:     {_Prt21, Prt22} = Test(new_ports, false, true),
  173:     [{trace, Prt22, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  174:         = flush(Prt22),
  175: 
  176:     {Prt31, _Prt32} = Test(existing, true, false),
  177:     [{trace, Prt31, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  178:         = flush(Prt31),
  179: 
  180:     {Prt41, _Prt42} = Test(existing_ports, true, false),
  181:     [{trace, Prt41, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  182:         = flush(Prt41),
  183: 
  184:     {Prt51, Prt52} = Test(all, true, true),
  185:     [{trace, Prt51, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  186:         = flush(Prt51),
  187:     [{trace, Prt52, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  188:         = flush(Prt52),
  189: 
  190:     {Prt61, Prt62} = Test(ports, true, true),
  191:     [{trace, Prt61, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  192:         = flush(Prt61),
  193:     [{trace, Prt62, 'receive', {S, {command,<<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP>>}}}]
  194:         = flush(Prt62),
  195: 
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: %% Test that the 'ports' trace flag works
  199: ports(_Config) ->
  200: 
  201:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open([ports],[binary]),
  202: 
  203:     [{trace, Prt, open, S, echo_drv},
  204:      {trace, Prt, getting_linked, S}] = flush(),
  205: 
  206:     register(?MODULE, Prt),
  207:     unregister(?MODULE),
  208:     register(?MODULE, Prt),
  209: 
  210:     [{trace,Prt,register,port_trace_SUITE},
  211:      {trace,Prt,unregister,port_trace_SUITE},
  212:      {trace,Prt,register,port_trace_SUITE}] = flush(),
  213: 
  214:     unlink(Prt),
  215:     link(Prt),
  216: 
  217:     [{trace,Prt,getting_unlinked,S},
  218:      {trace,Prt,getting_linked,S}] = flush(),
  219: 
  220:     erlang:port_close(Prt),
  221: 
  222:     [{trace,Prt,closed,normal},
  223:      {trace,Prt,unregister,port_trace_SUITE}] = flush(),
  224: 
  225:     ok.
  226: 
  227: %% Test that port_close and ! close generate correct trace messages
  228: open_close(_Config) ->
  229: 
  230:     S = trace_ports([send,'receive']),
  231: 
  232:     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [binary]),
  233:     erlang:port_close(Prt),
  234:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, close}}] = flush(),
  235: 
  236:     Prt2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [binary]),
  237:     Prt2 ! {S, close},
  238:     recv({Prt2, closed}),
  239:     [{trace, Prt2, 'receive', {S, close}},
  240:      {trace, Prt2, send, closed, S}] = flush(),
  241: 
  242:     catch erlang:port_close(Prt2),
  243:     [] = flush(),
  244: 
  245:     ok.
  246: 
  247: %% Test that port_command and ! command generate correct trace messages
  248: command(Config) ->
  249: 
  250:     Flags = [send,'receive'],
  251:     S = trace_ports(Flags),
  252:     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [binary]),
  253: 
  254:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8>>),
  255:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {command, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8>>}}}] = flush(),
  256: 
  257:     erlang:port_command(Prt, [?ECHO_DRV_NOOP, <<0:8>>]),
  258:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {command, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8,0:8>>}}}] = flush(),
  259: 
  260:     Prt ! {S, {command, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8>>}},
  261:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {command, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8>>}}}] = flush(),
  262: 
  263:     OutputMsg = <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8,0:(8*512)>>,
  264:     Prt ! {S, {command, OutputMsg}},
  265:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {command, OutputMsg}}}] = flush(),
  266: 
  267:     close(Prt, Flags),
  268: 
  269:     os:putenv("OUTPUTV","true"),
  270:     reload_drv(Config),
  271: 
  272:     Prt2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [binary]),
  273:     OutputvMsg = [<<0:8>>,<<0:(8*512)>>,<<0:(8*256)>>,<<0:8>>],
  274: 
  275:     erlang:port_command(Prt2, OutputvMsg),
  276:     [{trace, Prt2, 'receive', {S, {command, OutputvMsg}}}] = flush(),
  277: 
  278:     Prt2 ! {S, {command, OutputvMsg}},
  279:     [{trace, Prt2, 'receive', {S, {command, OutputvMsg}}}] = flush(),
  280: 
  281:     close(Prt2, Flags),
  282: 
  283:     os:unsetenv("OUTPUTV"),
  284: 
  285:     ok.
  286: 
  287: %% Test that port_control generate correct trace messages
  288: control(_Config) ->
  289: 
  290:     Flags = [send,'receive'],
  291:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  292: 
  293:     [0] = erlang:port_control(Prt, 1, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8, 0:8>>),
  294:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {control, {1, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8, 0:8>>}}}},
  295:      {trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {control, <<0:8>>}}, S}] = flush(),
  296: 
  297:     [0] = erlang:port_control(Prt, (1 bsl 32) - 1, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8, 0:8>>),
  298:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {control, {(1 bsl 32) - 1, <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8, 0:8>>}}}},
  299:      {trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {control, <<0:8>>}}, S}] = flush(),
  300: 
  301:     Msg = <<?ECHO_DRV_NOOP:8, 0:(8*512)>>,
  302:     Pat = lists:duplicate(512, 0),
  303:     Pat = erlang:port_control(Prt, 1, Msg),
  304:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {control, {1, Msg}}}},
  305:      {trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {control, <<0:(8*512)>>}}, S}] = flush(),
  306: 
  307:     close(Prt, Flags),
  308: 
  309:     ok.
  310: 
  311: %% Test that port_connect and ! connect generate correct trace messages
  312: %% This includes that the proper getting_linked messages are sent
  313: connect(_Config) ->
  314: 
  315: 
  316:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open([send, 'receive', ports],[binary]),
  317: 
  318:     flush(),
  319: 
  320:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(
  321:                   fun() ->
  322:                           receive
  323:                               go ->
  324:                                   Prt ! {self(), {connect, S}},
  325:                                   receive {Prt, connected} -> unlink(Prt) end
  326:                           end
  327:                   end),
  328:     erlang_trace(Pid, true, [send, 'receive', procs]),
  329: 
  330:     erlang:port_connect(Prt, Pid),
  331:     unlink(Prt),
  332: 
  333:     [{trace,Prt,getting_linked,Pid},
  334:      {trace,Prt,'receive',{S,{connect,Pid}}},
  335:      {trace,Prt,send,{Prt,connected},S},
  336:      {trace,Prt,getting_unlinked, S}] = flush(Prt),
  337: 
  338:     [{trace,Pid,getting_linked,Prt}] = flush(),
  339: 
  340:     Pid ! go,
  341:     recv({'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,normal}),
  342: 
  343:     [{trace,Prt,'receive',{Pid,{connect,S}}},
  344:      {trace,Prt,send,{Prt,connected},Pid},
  345:      {trace,Prt,getting_unlinked,Pid}] = flush(Prt),
  346: 
  347:     [{trace,Pid,'receive',go},
  348:      {trace,Pid,send,{Pid,{connect,S}}, Prt},
  349:      {trace,Pid,'receive',{Prt,connected}},
  350:      {trace,Pid,unlink,Prt},
  351:      {trace,Pid,exit,normal}] = flush(),
  352: 
  353:     erlang:port_close(Prt),
  354:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, close}},
  355:      {trace, Prt, closed, normal}] = flush(),
  356:     ok.
  357: 
  358: %% Test that port_call generate correct trace messages
  359: call(_Config) ->
  360: 
  361:     Flags = [send,'receive'],
  362:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  363: 
  364:     Test = fun(Msg) ->
  365:                    BinMsg = term_to_binary(Msg),
  366: 
  367:                    Msg = erlang:port_call(Prt, 0, Msg),
  368:                    [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {call, {0, BinMsg}}}},
  369:                     {trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {call, BinMsg}}, S}] = flush()
  370:            end,
  371: 
  372:     Test({hello, world, make_ref()}),
  373:     Test({hello, world, lists:seq(1,1000)}),
  374: 
  375:     close(Prt, Flags),
  376: 
  377:     ok.
  378: 
  379: %% Test that driver_output generate correct trace messages
  380: output(_Config) ->
  381: 
  382:     Flags = [send],
  383:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  384: 
  385:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT, 123456:32>>),
  386:     recv({Prt,{data,<<123456:32>>}}),
  387: 
  388:     [{trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {data, <<123456:32>>}}, S}] = flush(),
  389: 
  390:     close(Prt, Flags),
  391: 
  392:     ok.
  393: 
  394: %% Test that driver_output2 generate correct trace messages
  395: output2(_Config) ->
  396: 
  397:     Flags = [send],
  398:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  399: 
  400:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT2, 123456:32>>),
  401:     recv({Prt,{data,[$a|<<123456:32>>]}}),
  402:     [{trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {data, [$a|<<123456:32>>]}}, S}] = flush(),
  403: 
  404:     close(Prt, Flags),
  405: 
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: %% Test that driver_output_binary generate correct trace messages
  409: output_binary(_Config) ->
  410: 
  411:     Flags = [send],
  412:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  413: 
  414:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT_BINARY, 0, 123456:32>>),
  415:     recv({Prt,{data,[$a|<<123456:32>>]}}),
  416:     [{trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {data, [$a|<<123456:32>>]}}, S}] = flush(),
  417: 
  418:     close(Prt, Flags),
  419: 
  420:     ok.
  421: 
  422: %% Test that driver_outputv generate correct trace messages
  423: outputv(_Config) ->
  424: 
  425:     Flags = [send],
  426:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  427: 
  428:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_OUTPUTV, 123456:32>>),
  429:     recv({Prt,{data,[$a|<<123456:32>>]}}),
  430: 
  431:     [{trace, Prt, send, {Prt, {data, [$a|<<123456:32>>]}}, S}] = flush(),
  432: 
  433:     erlang:port_close(Prt),
  434:     [] = flush(),
  435: 
  436:     ok.
  437: 
  438: %% Test that driver_set_timer generate correct trace messages
  439: set_timer(_Config) ->
  440: 
  441:     Flags = [send,'receive'],
  442:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  443: 
  444:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_SET_TIMER>>),
  445:     timer:sleep(100),
  446:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {command, <<?ECHO_DRV_SET_TIMER>>}}},
  447:      {trace, Prt, 'receive', timeout}] = flush(),
  448: 
  449:     close(Prt, Flags),
  450: 
  451:     ok.
  452: 
  453: %% Test that driver_failure* generate correct trace messages
  454: failure_eof(_Config) ->
  455: 
  456:     Flags = [send,'receive', ports],
  457:     S = trace_ports(Flags),
  458: 
  459:     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [eof, binary]),
  460:     [{trace, Prt, open, S, echo_drv},
  461:      {trace, Prt, getting_linked, S}] = flush(),
  462: 
  463:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_EOF>>),
  464:     recv({Prt,eof}),
  465:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {command, <<?ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_EOF>>}}},
  466:      {trace, Prt, send, {Prt, eof}, S}] = flush(),
  467: 
  468:     close(Prt, Flags),
  469: 
  470:     %% Run same test without eof option
  471:     failure_test(<<?ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_EOF>>, normal).
  472: 
  473: failure_atom(_Config) ->
  474:     failure_test(<<?ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_ATOM, "failure\0">>, failure).
  475: failure_posix(_Config) ->
  476:     failure_test(<<?ECHO_DRV_FAILURE_POSIX>>, eagain).
  477: failure(_Config) ->
  478:     failure_test(<<?ECHO_DRV_FAILURE, 1>>, 1).
  479: 
  480: failure_test(Failure, Reason) ->
  481: 
  482:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open([send, 'receive', ports],[binary]),
  483: 
  484:     [{trace, Prt, open, S, echo_drv},
  485:      {trace, Prt, getting_linked, S}] = flush(),
  486: 
  487:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  488:     erlang:port_command(Prt, Failure),
  489:     try
  490:         recv({'EXIT',Prt,Reason})
  491:     after
  492:         process_flag(trap_exit, false)
  493:     end,
  494:     [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, {command, Failure}}},
  495:      {trace, Prt, closed, Reason}] = flush(),
  496: 
  497:     ok.
  498: 
  499: %% Test that erl_drv_output_term generate correct trace messages
  500: output_term(_Config) ->
  501: 
  502:     Flags = [send],
  503:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  504: 
  505:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_OUTPUT_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  506:     recv({echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}),
  507:     [{trace, Prt, send, {echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}, S}] = flush(),
  508: 
  509:     close(Prt, Flags),
  510: 
  511:     ok.
  512: 
  513: %% Test that driver_output_term generate correct trace messages
  514: driver_output_term(_Config) ->
  515: 
  516:     Flags = [send],
  517:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  518: 
  519:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_DRIVER_OUTPUT_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  520:     recv({echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}),
  521:     [{trace, Prt, send, {echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}, S}] = flush(),
  522: 
  523:     close(Prt, Flags),
  524: 
  525:     ok.
  526: 
  527: %% Test that erl_drv_send_term generate correct trace messages
  528: send_term(_Config) ->
  529: 
  530:     Flags = [send],
  531:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  532: 
  533:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_SEND_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  534:     recv({echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}),
  535:     [{trace, Prt, send, {echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}, S}] = flush(),
  536: 
  537:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_SAVE_CALLER>>) end),
  538:     recv({'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,normal}),
  539:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_SEND_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  540:     [{trace, Prt, send_to_non_existing_process, {echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}, Pid}] = flush(),
  541: 
  542:     close(Prt, Flags),
  543: 
  544:     ok.
  545: 
  546: %% Test that driver_send_term generate correct trace messages
  547: driver_send_term(_Config) ->
  548: 
  549:     Flags = [send],
  550:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  551: 
  552:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_DRIVER_SEND_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  553:     recv({echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}),
  554:     [{trace, Prt, send, {echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}, S}] = flush(),
  555: 
  556:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_SAVE_CALLER>>) end),
  557:     recv({'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,normal}),
  558:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_SEND_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  559:     [{trace, Prt, send_to_non_existing_process, {echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}, Pid}] = flush(),
  560: 
  561:     close(Prt, Flags),
  562: 
  563:     ok.
  564: 
  565: %% Test that driver_send_term from non-scheduler thread does not
  566: %% generate trace messages.
  567: driver_remote_send_term(_Config) ->
  568: 
  569:     Flags = [send],
  570:     {Prt, S} = trace_and_open(Flags,[binary]),
  571: 
  572:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_REMOTE_SEND_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  573:     recv({echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}),
  574:     [] = flush(),
  575: 
  576:     Pid = spawn_link(
  577:             fun() ->
  578:                     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_SAVE_CALLER>>),
  579:                     S ! ok,
  580:                     receive M -> S ! M end
  581:             end),
  582:     recv(ok),
  583:     erlang_trace(Pid, true, ['receive']),
  584: 
  585:     erlang:port_command(Prt, <<?ECHO_DRV_REMOTE_SEND_TERM, 123456:32>>),
  586:     recv({echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}),
  587:     [{trace, Pid, 'receive', {echo, Prt, <<123456:32>>}}] = flush(),
  588: 
  589:     close(Prt, Flags),
  590: 
  591:     ok.
  592: 
  593: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  594: %% Helper functions
  595: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  596: 
  597: trace_ports(TraceFlags) ->
  598:     erlang_trace(new_ports, true, TraceFlags),
  599:     self().
  600: 
  601: trace_and_open(TraceFlags, OpenFlags) ->
  602:     S = self(),
  603:     Ports = proplists:get_value(ports, TraceFlags),
  604:     [trace_ports(TraceFlags) || Ports],
  605:     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, OpenFlags),
  606:     [erlang_trace(Prt, true, TraceFlags) || Ports == undefined],
  607:     {Prt, S}.
  608: 
  609: close(Prt, Flags) ->
  610:     Recv = proplists:get_value('receive', Flags),
  611:     Ports = proplists:get_value(ports, Flags),
  612:     S = self(),
  613: 
  614:     erlang:port_close(Prt),
  615: 
  616:     if Recv, Ports ->
  617:             [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, close}},
  618:              {trace, Prt, closed, normal}] = flush();
  619:        Recv ->
  620:             [{trace, Prt, 'receive', {S, close}}] = flush();
  621:        Ports ->
  622:             [{trace, Prt, closed, normal}] = flush();
  623:        true ->
  624:             [] = flush()
  625:     end.
  626: 
  627: trace_delivered() ->
  628:     Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(all),
  629:     receive {trace_delivered, all, Ref} -> ok end.
  630: 
  631: flush() ->
  632:     flush(all).
  633: flush(From) ->
  634:     trace_delivered(),
  635:     f(From).
  636: 
  637: f(From) ->
  638:     receive
  639:         M when From =:= all; element(2, M) == From ->
  640:             [M | f(From)]
  641:     after 0 ->
  642:             []
  643:     end.
  644: 
  645: recv(Msg) ->
  646:     receive Msg -> ok after 1000 -> ct:fail({did_not_get_data,Msg,flush()}) end.
  647: 
  648: load_drv(Config) ->
  649:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  650:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Path, echo_drv) of
  651:         ok -> ok;
  652:         {error, Error} = Res ->
  653:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
  654: 	    ct:fail(Res)
  655:     end.
  656: 
  657: reload_drv(Config) ->
  658:     erl_ddll:unload_driver(echo_drv),
  659:     load_drv(Config).
